definition: evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
virtue has its reward, evil its retribution
pinyin: shan4 you3 shan4 bao4 , e4 you3 e4 bao4

definition: Good has its reward and evil has its recompense. The payback is just a matter of time
pinyin: shan4 you3 shan4 bao4 , e4 you3 e4 bao4 , ruo4 ran2 bu4 bao4 shi2 chen2 wei4 dao4
containing_words.word: 善有善報，惡有惡報，若然不報時晨未到

sentences.english: When the being killed is immoral, then you get less bad results.
sentences.chinese: 如果被殺者是無德的，那麼你得的惡報少一些。

sentences.english: Shall evil be recompensed for good? for they have digged a pit for my soul.
sentences.chinese: 豈可以惡報善呢？他們竟挖坑要害我的性命。

sentences.english: To commit no sin is better than retribution and renunciation of sin.
sentences.chinese: 與其得了惡報而後脫離惡道，不如不去犯罪。

sentences.english: What’s a good way to improve it?
sentences.chinese: 有什麼好的辦法可以免遭惡報嗎？

sentences.english: One by one, the guilty will pay.
sentences.chinese: 惡有惡報，終將付出代價。

sentences.english: His good intentions were repaid by evil results.
sentences.chinese: 他的好心卻得到了惡報。

sentences.english: Shall evil be recompensed for good?
Her good intentions were repaid by evil results.
sentences.chinese: 她的好心卻受到了惡報。

sentences.english: Wrong-doers are usually paid out in the end.
sentences.chinese: 幹壞事的人最終常會受到惡報。

sentences.english: Now it's time for pay back of its evil.
sentences.chinese: 現在是是他們惡有惡報的時候了。

sentences.english: "Well, " the frog said, "I thellos is las toman ah.
sentences.chinese: “唉，”田雞回答說，“我這是惡有惡報呀。

sentences.english: They rewarded me evil for good to the spoiling of my soul.
sentences.chinese: 他們向我以惡報善，使我的靈魂孤苦。

sentences.english: Those who repay my good with evil slander me when I pursue what is good.
sentences.chinese: 以惡報善的與我作對，因我是追求良善。

sentences.english: Justin, what do you think karma is?
sentences.chinese: 賈斯汀，你覺得什麼是惡報呢？

sentences.english: He has paid me back evil for good.
I know something was going to happen to him, because what goes around comes around.
sentences.chinese: 我曉得早晚會有禍出在他身上，因爲做惡事有惡報。

definition: displaying fully/developing to the greatest extent
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
variant of 輾轉|辗转[zhan3 zhuan3]
